alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 3:25AM EDT until October 12 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.0 to 7.2 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to noon EDT today. * IMPACTS...This could result in some roads becoming impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 10:22 AM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 12/10 AM 7.1 1.3 0.7 N/A Minor 12/10 PM 6.3 0.5 0.9 N/A None 13/11 AM 6.9 1.1 0.6 N/A None 13/11 PM 5.6 -0.2 0.4 N/A None 14/12 PM 6.3 0.5 0.3 N/A None 15/12 AM 5.2 -0.6 0.3 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
